0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Renal isotope studies, Of Renal Parenchymal Disorders: 74 to 222 megabecquerels (2 to 6 millicuries) slow IV INJECTION between 10 minutes and 4 hours following preparation for an average patient (70 kg); renal images may be obtained 1 to 2 hours after injection

2.title: Dose Adjustments
2.mono:
• renal failure, advance: may exhibit poor renal intake of technetium Tc 99m succimer; however, reports of satisfactory images have been obtained in some patients upon delaying imaging for up to 24 hours
  • geriatric: start at the low end of the dosing range

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Renal isotope studies, Of Renal Parenchymal Disorders

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• radiopharmaceutical, maintain adequate shielding and handle with care to minimize exposure to the patient and personnel
  • renal failure, advanced; poor renal uptake possible; delaying imaging for up to 24 hours may be required for satisfactory images
  • renal impairment; increased risk for toxicity; monitoring recommended

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• AAP: Radioactive compounds that require temporary cessation of breastfeeding.
  • WHO: Avoid breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Milk effects are possible.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Technetium Tc 99m succimer injection is a diagnostic radiopharmaceutical that is cleared renally, concentrating in the renal cortex, which allows radiographic imaging of the renal parenchyma.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
General Information
  • use waterproof gloves, effective radiation shielding, and appropriate safety measures during preparation and administration
  • place 1 of the vials in a suitable shielding container and swab the closure with a bacteriostatic swab
  • before reconstitution, the eluate may be adjusted to the correct radioactive concentration by dilution with preservative-free, nonbacteriostatic saline for injection.
  • using a 10-mL sterile syringe, inject an appropriate amount (not more than 1.4 gigabecquerels (40 millicuries) in a volume of 1 to 6 mL) of the eluate from a Tc 99m generator into the shielded vial; before removing the syringe from the vial, withdraw an equivalent volume of nitrogen from the space above the solution to normalize the pressure in the vial
  • carefully invert the vial a few times until the powder is completely dissolved
  • assay the total activity, complete the label provided and attach to the vial; if radiochemical purity is not adequate, discard the finished drug
  • incubate the vial for at least 10 minutes at room temperature
  • use the preparation between 10 minutes and 4 hours following reconstitution; discard any unused portion appropriately according to state or other regulations
  • administer technetium Tc 99m succimer by slow IV injection

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• quality scintigraphic images are indicative of efficacy
  • renal function; especially in elderly and renally impaired patients

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause rare instances of syncope, fever, nausea, and maculopapular skin rash.
  • Instruct patient to notify their healthcare provider if they are breastfeeding or intend to breastfeed during or around the time of therapy; formula feedings are recommended.
